greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers not divisible by 7.
comment: Numbers that are congruent to {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6} mod 7. Different from A020658.
More generally the sequence of numbers not divisible by some fixed integer m >= 2 is given by a(n,m) = n - 1 + floor((n+m-2)/(m-1)). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jul 11 2009
Complement of A008589; A109720(a(n))=1; A082784(a(n))=0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 30 2009
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,0,0,1,-1).
program: (Sage) [i for i in range(67) if gcd(7,i) == 1] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 21 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
